intro: Eleocharis obsoleta, commonly known as slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. This plant typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Eleocharis obsoleta is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to tolerate fluctuating water levels. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and wetland ecosystems.
